newsitem.title: FRANCE: Marseille April air cargo traffic down 18.7 pct.
newsitem.headline: Marseille April air cargo traffic down 18.7 pct.

text.p: Marseille airport said it handled 3,011 tonnes of flown air cargo traffic last month, down 18.7 percent on April 1996.

"The sharp decline can be largely attributed to French express operator, TAT Express, transferring part of its airborne traffic (flown by French airline, L'Aeropostale) from Marseille to Montpellier," a Marseille airport official told Reuters.

Other factors behind the slump included industrial action at Air France Europe and the airline's operation of lower cargo capacity aircraft (Airbus 319 and 320s) on passenger flights to and from Marseille compared to A300 and A330s - both of which accomodate palletised freight in service in April 1996," the official said.

Marseille airport's January-April 1997 flown airfreight traffic totalled 13,886 tonnes, down five percent on the same period the previous year, the official added. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
